trans-unit.source: Setting up Application Insights for your Service Fabric application
trans-unit.target: Setting up Application Insights for your Service Fabric application

trans-unit.source: Receive Service Fabric events for your application in Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Receive Service Fabric events for your application in Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Setting up Application Insights for your Service Fabric application
trans-unit.target: Setting up Application Insights for your Service Fabric application

trans-unit.source: This article will walk you through enabling Application Insights for your Service Fabric application.
trans-unit.target: This article will walk you through enabling Application Insights for your Service Fabric application.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This article assumes you have a Service Fabric application already created in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This article assumes you have a Service Fabric application already created in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: To find out how [click here](service-fabric-reliable-services-quick-start.md).
trans-unit.target: To find out how [click here](service-fabric-reliable-services-quick-start.md).

trans-unit.source: Installing the NuGet package
trans-unit.target: Installing the NuGet package

trans-unit.source: Released as part of the Service Fabric SDK is a prerelease version of our nuget package Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Telemetry.ApplicationInsights.
trans-unit.target: Released as part of the Service Fabric SDK is a prerelease version of our nuget package Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Telemetry.ApplicationInsights.

trans-unit.source: This package ties together the Service Fabric EventSource events with Application Insights to give you automated instrumentation of your Service Fabric app.
trans-unit.target: This package ties together the Service Fabric EventSource events with Application Insights to give you automated instrumentation of your Service Fabric app.

trans-unit.source: This package will be continue to be updated with new events which will be automatically emitted by your application.
trans-unit.target: This package will be continue to be updated with new events which will be automatically emitted by your application.

trans-unit.source: You can install the package with the following steps:
trans-unit.target: You can install the package with the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Open the NuGet Package Manager for your Service Fabric app.
trans-unit.target: Open the NuGet Package Manager for your Service Fabric app.

trans-unit.source: This can be done by right-clicking your project in Visual Studio and selecting 'Manage NuGet Packages...'.
trans-unit.target: This can be done by right-clicking your project in Visual Studio and selecting 'Manage NuGet Packages...'.

trans-unit.source: You will need to select 'Microsoft Azure Service Fabric' as your package source to list packages included in the Service Fabric SDK.
trans-unit.target: You will need to select 'Microsoft Azure Service Fabric' as your package source to list packages included in the Service Fabric SDK.

trans-unit.source: VS2015 NuGet Package Manager
trans-unit.target: VS2015 NuGet Package Manager

trans-unit.source: Select the Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Telemetry.ApplicationInsights package on the left.
trans-unit.target: Select the Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Telemetry.ApplicationInsights package on the left.

trans-unit.source: Click Install to begin the install process.
trans-unit.target: Click Install to begin the install process.

trans-unit.source: Review and accept the EULA.
trans-unit.target: Review and accept the EULA.

trans-unit.source: Enabling Service Fabric events
trans-unit.target: Enabling Service Fabric events

trans-unit.source: In order to receive Service Fabric events automatically in Application Insights you will need to enable our listener.
trans-unit.target: In order to receive Service Fabric events automatically in Application Insights you will need to enable our listener.

trans-unit.source: You can do this by inserting the following line of code into your app.
trans-unit.target: You can do this by inserting the following line of code into your app.

trans-unit.source: Example for StatefulActor\Program.cs:
trans-unit.target: Example for StatefulActor\Program.cs:

trans-unit.source: You can learn about the events emitted from the Reliable Actors runtime [here](service-fabric-reliable-actors-diagnostics.md) and Reliable Services runtime [here](service-fabric-reliable-services-diagnostics.md).
trans-unit.target: You can learn about the events emitted from the Reliable Actors runtime [here](service-fabric-reliable-actors-diagnostics.md) and Reliable Services runtime [here](service-fabric-reliable-services-diagnostics.md).

trans-unit.source: Note that in order to get Reliable Actors runtime method calls, EventLevel.Verbose must be used (as shown in examples above).
trans-unit.target: Note that in order to get Reliable Actors runtime method calls, EventLevel.Verbose must be used (as shown in examples above).

trans-unit.source: Setting up Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Setting up Application Insights

trans-unit.source: An instrumentation key is what ties your Service Fabric app to your Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: An instrumentation key is what ties your Service Fabric app to your Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: You can learn how to get your instrumentation key by following [Application Insight's guide](../app-insights-create-new-resource.md#create-an-application-insights-resource).
trans-unit.target: You can learn how to get your instrumentation key by following [Application Insight's guide](../app-insights-create-new-resource.md#create-an-application-insights-resource).

trans-unit.source: Select 'Other' for application type when creating resources.
trans-unit.target: Select 'Other' for application type when creating resources.

trans-unit.source: Select Other for AI app type
trans-unit.target: Select Other for AI app type

trans-unit.source: Once you have your instrumentation key, you can insert it into the ApplicationInsights.config file like so:
trans-unit.target: Once you have your instrumentation key, you can insert it into the ApplicationInsights.config file like so:

trans-unit.source: Viewing data
trans-unit.target: Viewing data

trans-unit.source: You can [customize the App Insights blade](../app-insights-metrics-explorer.md) to fit your needs.
trans-unit.target: You can [customize the App Insights blade](../app-insights-metrics-explorer.md) to fit your needs.

trans-unit.source: Most Service Fabric events will show up as 'Custom Events', while Fabric Actor method calls and service RunAsync() calls will show up as requests.
trans-unit.target: Most Service Fabric events will show up as 'Custom Events', while Fabric Actor method calls and service RunAsync() calls will show up as requests.

trans-unit.source: Modeling these events as requests allows you to use the 'request name' dimension and 'request duration' metric when building charts.
trans-unit.target: Modeling these events as requests allows you to use the 'request name' dimension and 'request duration' metric when building charts.

trans-unit.source: New charts, metrics, and events will continue to be added which you will be able to leverage in the future.
trans-unit.target: New charts, metrics, and events will continue to be added which you will be able to leverage in the future.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Learn more about using Application Insights to instrument your Service Fabric apps.
